subject: AI & Agents
title: Why AI Hallucinates
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why AI Hallucinates.

hook.text: Ask an AI for a source and it might cite a paper that doesn't exist â€” confidently.

buildup.text: Language models generate the most probable next words. Probability isn't truth.

discovery.text: When the model lacks knowledge, it fills the gap with plausible-sounding fiction.

twist.text: A lawyer submitted AI-generated legal briefs citing six fake court cases. The judge wasn't amused.

climax.text: Hallucination is a feature of how generation works, not a bug that can be simply patched.

quiz.question: Why do language models 'hallucinate'?
options: They generate probable text, not verified truth
